result.execSummary:
The defendant Ler Wah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- No firearms/weapons

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

- Complete a parenting class.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ler Wah

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ler Wah in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Ler Wah in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Ler Wah in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 103 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Complete a parenting class.  
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.i
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Ler Wah in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Ler Wah in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Ler Wah not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/15/15 in Branch 40.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Ler Wah not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel would like another date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Ler Wah not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail hearing waived.  Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KAW M. OR HER CHILDREN AND THA P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Sworn as BURMESE interpreter:  SIMON KOKO.

Defendant Ler Wah in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Ler Wah in custody.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
